IDES140.name: Design for Living
IDES140.semester: Fall of every year, Summer of every year
IDES140.description: Interior design from the human ecological perspective. The reciprocal impact of the designed environment on human behavior, design terminology, and the design process.

IDES142.name: Design Theory Studio
IDES142.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
IDES142.description: Design elements and principles in creative problem solving.
IDES142.restrictions: Open to students in the Interior Design Major.

IDES150.name: Interior Design Drafting
IDES150.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
IDES150.description: Drafting and two-dimensional drawing for interior design.
IDES150.restrictions: Open to students in the Interior Design Major.

IDES152.name: Interior Environments
IDES152.description: Interior design fundamentals and human behavior. Space planning, furnishing, and selection of materials and components for residential and commercial interiors.

IDES240.name: Computer-Aided Design for Designers
IDES240.semester: Fall of every year, Summer of every year

IDES250.name: 3D Modeling and Visualization
IDES250.description: Applications in 3D modeling, digital visualization, and structural principles in generating design solutions.

IDES252.name: Interior Design Synthesis I
IDES252.description: Design process with emphasis on problem resolution for residential and commercial interiors.
IDES252.prerequisite: IDES 140 and IDES 142 and IDES 150 and IDES 152
IDES252.restrictions: Open to sophomores or juniors or seniors in the Interior Design Major.

IDES340.name: Interior Design Specifications and Workroom Practices
IDES340.description: Specifications and workroom practices used for fabrication and installation of design solutions for interior spaces.
IDES340.prerequisite: (IDES 252) and completion of Tier I writing requirement

IDES342.name: Interior Design: Human Dimensions
IDES342.description: Human dimensions as determining factors in designing human environments. Standards and concepts of universal fit.

IDES343.name: Interior Design Presentation and Media
IDES343.description: Design communication through two- and three-dimensional drawings in media. Presentation procedures and techniques.
IDES343.restrictions: Open to juniors and open to seniors in the Interior Design Major. Approval of department.

IDES344.name: History of Interior Design: Ancient Through Rococo
IDES344.description: Historical development of furniture, textiles, and other decorative arts in interior design and architecture.

IDES350.name: Interior Design Lighting and Environmental Systems
IDES350.description: Lighting and environmental systems including lighting, ventilation, acoustics, heating and cooling. Integration of lighting and environmental systems with interior space.

IDES352.name: Interior Design Synthesis II
IDES352.description: Concept development and problem solving in design of interior spaces to meet human and environmental needs. Cultural diversity and client interaction.

IDES354.name: History of Interior Design: Neo-Classical Through Modern
IDES354.description: Historical development of furniture, textiles and the other decorative arts from the neoclassical through the modern period. Major social, cultural, and psychological influences.

IDES393.name: Introduction to Professional Practice
IDES393.description: Introduction to the design profession and its opportunities, focusing on career planning and preparation.

IDES440.name: Contemporary Design Issues
IDES440.description: Issues related to design professionals and their clients.
IDES440.prerequisite: (IDES 442) and completion of Tier I writing requirement

IDES441.name: Interior Design Open Office Systems
IDES441.description: Planning and design of open office systems including panel and electrical plans, power plan development, furniture and lighting layouts, specifications, and presentation. Offered first half of semester.

IDES442.name: Interior Design Programming
IDES442.description: Identifying, programming, and preparing schematics of the senior interior design project. Studio sketch portfolio guidelines. Site visits required.
IDES442.prerequisite: (IDES 350 and IDES 352) and completion of Tier I writing requirement

IDES451.name: Interior Design Professional Practice
IDES451.description: Professional practice standards, ethics, and client interaction in interior design. Field trip required.
IDES451.prerequisite: (IDES 442) and completion of Tier I writing requirement
IDES451.restrictions: Open to seniors in the Interior Design Major.

IDES452.name: Interior Design Synthesis III
IDES452.description: Advanced studio processes for solving complex interior design problems. Studio application of professional practice standards to specific capstone projects. Field trip required.
IDES452.prerequisite: (IDES 442) and completion of Tier I writing requirement
IDES452.restrictions: Open to seniors in the Interior Design Major.

IDES454.name: Revit for Designers
IDES454.description: Concepts and application of building information modeling for interior design applications using Revit.

IDES456.name: Historic Preservation and Sustainability
IDES456.semester: Fall of every year, Summer of every year
IDES456.description: The interior design component of the preservation movement. Historic restoration and adaptive reuse.
IDES456.restrictions: Open to students in the Interior Design Major.

IDES490.name: Independent Study
IDES490.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
IDES490.description: Supervised individual study in interior design.
IDES490.restrictions: Not open to freshmen or sophomores. Approval of department.

IDES816.name: Environmental Design Theory
IDES816.description: Differences between normative theories, scientific theories, models, and constructs. Exploration of normative theories related to thesis or practicum.

IDES883.name: Environmental Design Seminar
IDES883.description: Examination of the breadth of environmental design projects. Literature review of focused projects. Development of practicum or thesis proposals.
IDES883.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Department of Horticulture or in the School of Planning, Design and Construction.

IDES890.name: Supervised Independent Study in Interior Design and Human Environment
IDES890.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
IDES890.description: Independent study in topics related to facilities design and management, human shelter, or interior design preservation and conservation.
IDES890.restrictions: Open to graduate students. Approval of department.

IDES891.name: Topics in Interior Design and Human Environment
IDES891.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
IDES891.description: Selected topics related to facilities design and management, human shelter, or interior design preservation and conservation.
IDES891.restrictions: Open to seniors or graduate students in the Interior Design major.

IDES892.name: Research Fundamentals in Environmental Design
IDES892.description: An overview of research literature and methods in environmental design.
IDES892.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Environmental Design major.

IDES898.name: Master's Project
IDES898.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
IDES898.description: Master's degree Plan B project. Participation in a project in interior design.
IDES898.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Interior Design and Facilities Management major or approval of school.

IDES899.name: Master's Thesis Research
IDES899.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
IDES899.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Interior Design and Facilities Management major or approval of school.
